speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: SCENE III. London. A street.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter two Citizens meeting

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Neighbour, well met: whither away so fast?

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: I promise you, I scarcely know myself:

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Hear you the news abroad?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Ay, that the king is dead.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Bad news, by'r lady; seldom comes the better:

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: I fear, I fear 'twill prove a troublous world.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Enter another Citizen

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Neighbours, God speed!

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Give you good morrow, sir.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Doth this news hold of good King Edward's death?

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Ay, sir, it is too true; God help the while!

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Then, masters, look to see a troublous world.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: No, no; by God's good grace his son shall reign.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Woe to the land that's govern'd by a child!

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: In him there is a hope of government,

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: That in his nonage council under him,

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: And in his full and ripen'd years himself,

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: No doubt, shall then and till then govern well.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: So stood the state when Henry the Sixth

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Was crown'd in Paris but at nine months old.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Stood the state so? No, no, good friends, God wot;

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: For then this land was famously enrich'd

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: With politic grave counsel; then the king

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Had virtuous uncles to protect his grace.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Why, so hath this, both by the father and mother.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Better it were they all came by the father,

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Or by the father there were none at all;

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: For emulation now, who shall be nearest,

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Will touch us all too near, if God prevent not.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: O, full of danger is the Duke of Gloucester!

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: And the queen's sons and brothers haught and proud:

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: And were they to be ruled, and not to rule,

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: This sickly land might solace as before.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Come, come, we fear the worst; all shall be well.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: When clouds appear, wise men put on their cloaks;

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: When great leaves fall, the winter is at hand;

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: When the sun sets, who doth not look for night?

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Untimely storms make men expect a dearth.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: All may be well; but, if God sort it so,

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: 'Tis more than we deserve, or I expect.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Truly, the souls of men are full of dread:

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Ye cannot reason almost with a man

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: That looks not heavily and full of fear.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Before the times of change, still is it so:

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: By a divine instinct men's minds mistrust

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Ensuing dangers; as by proof, we see

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: The waters swell before a boisterous storm.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: But leave it all to God. whither away?

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Marry, we were sent for to the justices.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: And so was I: I'll bear you company.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Exeunt
